intro: Bulga laxmannii, commonly known as the slender rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
